title: Amazing game. Download this.

You will die - a lot - and most runs will be terrible, and some will be incredible. Don't be afraid to look up the wiki for the starting guide, it helped me deal with hunger issues. Still wish there was maybe 25% more food dropped, as starvation usually ends up as less of a threat and more of an annoyance. Devs are great, 10/10

It also fails to save game progress when you hit the phone's back button or don't exit from the app.  I have had games where I'm in the prison and one phone call, kablamy.. game never happened.  I also agree about the weapons degrading.  It should be a challenge not a built in feature.  Currently game success is more up to luck than skill.

title: Can't play as a girl unless you beat the game?
comment: I really enjoy this game as a guy, and I'm sure many girls are happy to play it. But if you're going to have an RPG with classes to choose from, why not add an option to play as both genders for each class? Nearly half of all gamers are women, why alienate half of your target group? I realize that this may not seem like a big deal to some, but there is a huge lack of playable female characters in the gaming world and to see this game contribute to the problem saddens me.

title: Fun, very hard rogue like
comment: Check out the Shattered Pixel version as well! This one has good graphics, sound, environments, fun to explore. Very tough, especially with degradation. Food timer is frustrating. Very luck based, often impossible to win. Reading the wiki is very helpful -- in game explanations are lacking (you always hit monsters when they open doors: that's how to kill wraiths!). I find the shattered pixel version more enjoyable personally. No degradation, better explanations, cool artefact items.

title: Wraiths spawn too much and are too strong
comment: At floor 1 you dig up a grave and 4 wraiths spawn and you die withing two tries of hitting them, please make them spawn less and make them easier to kill as well as make their hits slightly weaker

Perhaps item degradation can be added as a new challenge rather than a core mechanic. The reason for this is because most players who finish the game on earlier versions do so with heavily upgraded items. Alternatively, if it HAS to be a new gameplay mechanic, I would suggest making it happen only on, say, +5 or greater items, with a higher chance of degradation on items with more upgrades. Doing so would still up the late-game challenge without any effects on the early-game, which is difficult enough.

title: Too difficult to be fun.
comment: What used to be the most amazing game on Android now joins the rest in being just 'meh'. The introduction of item degradation has made a challenging game downright impossible, and as such removes much of the replay fun of previous versions. Before, there was always a chance of a great random drop that could be upgraded as you went through the levels. Now, even a good random drop becomes useless, as as fast as scrolls appear to boost your gear, your gear degrades, removing any incentive to upgrade at all.

title: Dev's, please stop while it is still good
comment: This has long been a 5-star game for me - a rogue-like with just enough freedom to make it fun. The level generator is pretty good. The randomness and variety keep you invested in the adventure. Sadly, the new equipment degrading mechanic took the game a long way towards being an Excel puzzle. It fills the game with nail-biting frustration of wasting your upgrades and carrying around junk items. Could you please instead spend your time on making a new class or additional levels? Please?

title: Remove degradation!
comment: Masterfully created dungeon crawl, I have at least 500 hours of play on this game. Best in the store. My qualms are the vast gap in character scaling and ability before upgrades, and the degradation system; it adds arbitrary difficulty and kills strategy around Upgrd Scroll use, and forces my hand to prevent wasting a +2 by making it +3. System before was better; we could hoard Upgr Scrolls until we found a higher tier item, and upgrade enchanted weapons past +3, keeping the same one using Ench scrolls.

title: Learning Curve n RNG
comment: There is a learning curve to the game that takes many deaths to surpass but the game's rng can be too unforgiving at times. The game should always have a way out. The most skilled players can be fucked over by the rng and doing every right step might not even lead you to victory because some monster might have paried you 5x. It relies too heavily on rng to be respectable. The difficulty is made artificially bby rng so being skilled won't make you concistantly beat anything past the first boss.

comment: Fun rogue like.  Difficult at times, but the frustration of early senseless deaths is made up for with one flawless perfect game.  - edit 4/27 I've had this game over 18 months, but degradation adds nothing to this game, ruins an already great game and pushes it to the unlikable.  Sadly, I can't endorse this game any longer, as I consider replacing it permanently with Shattered Pixel Dungeon instead.

title: Used To Be Better
comment: I played the Heavens out of this game. It was addictive, intuitive and with practice, understanding the "rules" of the world, totally fun time-waster. I stopped playing though, when they added weapon and armor degradation. With the system that is used, that's unacceptable. It's balanced out by adding more weapons, but with limited inventory, such hoarding is rarely doable or practical. That almost kills it for me, so despite my better judgment, four stars for me. It's challenging, but if can deal with that aforementioned problem, Pixel Dungeon is great. My advice, on the other hand: go for Shattered Pixel Dungeon, instead; that awful degrade system has yet to be incorporated as of this writing, which makes the game almost perfect. Plus, balancing issues are smoothed out, and more content has been added. It's well worth the price of admission.

title: A terrible remake
comment: The game is completely set against you.  While I played the original Rogue this was based upon, this version has a sadistic twist where too many items are cursed, traps abound to slaughter you at whim and even useful items are a guessing game for survival.  Survival is far less about skill than it is blind luck and no solid decision making can save a character for more than a few minutes.  Absolutely dreadful.

title: Near Perfect
comment: This is mobile game done right. You can play it in short bursts or full runs at a time and maintain progress. Ads aren't intrusive if there are any. The game is both fun and immersive. A lot of people compare this to Darks Souls just because of the times you die. Dark Souls does NOT delete your Undead everytime you die and randomly generate everything up from the beginning. title: The Great Crabification.
comment: OK, look. This game SHOULD work on paper: a simple dungeon crawler with random generation and 1 life. Simple, right? Oh... you have no idea how complicated and difficult it truly is.  A majority of your play-throughs will end ~3-5 floors in. Reason being? CRABS. They have a special trait: being able to dodge AND parry your attack. Not to mention that you are slower than the attacker, and cannot run from it. So when you have little health and see one, you die.

title: Lame
comment: This game is not hard, it's just luck every time. You can one-hit monsters on the first level, but they can also dodge your attacks infinite times in a row (later on they can parry as well), this can get you killed at any stage in the game. Due to the poorly randomized level generator, 90% of your games leave you ill-prepared to deal with the level 5 boss; you will see the first four levels a LOT. But wait, there's more BS; non-optional nightmode, where if you play at night, the RNG is slanted even further in the enemy's favour (there is no reward for this increased risk). Despite all this, the interface is very nice, and the game is frustratingly addicting. However I would recommend "Dweller" or "Infinite Dungeon" instead, If you want a good roguelike. Edit: forgot to add, an update introduced item durability, so the 1in10 of those runs that are worth playing because you find a nice armor/weapon, you lose it shortly thereafter. Even those fans loyal to this game (who knows why) who gave been playing a long time think this is stupid, devs don't give a s**t though.

title: Pretty good, just a few things.
comment: They fixed the enemies being too OP, so I like the game now. I REALLY wish that they would put a save option in, because several times I have gotten good only to be killed under ridiculous circumstances, like finding a fire trap, being set on fire, and dieing from max health. I really think that you should add an auto save feature on every floor that you pass. Just an idea. I do think that the game is just a little bit too hard, seeing as the slimes are near-invincible, but impossible to put down.

title: [Edit] Was brilliant, enjoyment ruined by degradation shoe horning
comment: Throw my name in as well as a long time player (introduced many friends to it as well) whose enjoyment of it ended with the degradation addition. Psychologically it renders item usage a undesirable to me and so every single time I hit an enemy I'm getting a negative feeling rather than the most basic of gaming pleasure.  I don't doubt that the game can still be played with this feature, the problem is it's not fun to play anymore and so I've completely stopped. I'm amazed that the dev has decided to stick to this enforcement even though he's alienating and losing a huge portion of his player/fanbase.  I know it's a free game (though I donated) but it just feels like a lack of respect for the insane amount of players who are saying "please change it so I can enjoy the game again"?  I understand the urge to say "You'll find you enjoy it more if you just..." but to actually say "so play it this way or not at all" is just rude
Great game have so much fun getting better and smarter each time I play it.

title: A hidden gem, a game true to itself and what it wants to be played as
comment: The game at first was extremely difficult. It had me dying at floor 3 every time. Although I died a lot I was determined to reach at least the first boss...eventually I did, but I was completely destroyed in the first few moves. I realized something after a few more tries, that I had learned new skills I could use in each new playthrough, I saw that I was progressing as a player, not my character. this is genius, the player is the one gaining experience, becoming a better dungeon crawler by mind, not XP.

title: Degradation killed it
comment: I get what you were trying to to with implementing degradation watabou: you wanted to make gear that wasn't in the higher tiers still viable to use. The problem is that degradation really just adds more of a luck and tedium factor to a game that had really good balance. The game just isn't fun with forced degradation. My suggestion would be to make  degradation one of the challenges, or just rework it altogether. Right now, though, I'll just stick to shattered

title: Luck vs difficulty
comment: This is a game in which difficulty is almost entirely dictated by a random number generator. Even a seasoned and skilled player can and likely will be ruined by the game deciding not to give anything useful or by dropping endless enemies you can not defeat. Dark souls was hard, but it was entirely fair. This can not compare as much as everyone I see doing so. Making a game that deals entirely in random chance is the sign of poor game design. Does it make for replayability? Yes, but not fun replayability.

Then I end up stepping on a fire trap and having them burn up, or simply die without ever finding something to use them on. I've been playing this app for years and it's still amazing and the updates add to the fun!

title: Best Roguelike On Android
comment: Pixel Dungeon gets my vote for best roguelike dungeon-crawler on Android devices. The design of this game with its randomly generated dungeons, loot, mobs, and so forth keep you coming back for more. There is literally nothing I would change about this game. At first it may seem very challenging, but that's the allure with roguelike games. I found myself getting better at exploring the dungeons with each time I started a new playthrough. An absolute must-download. Five stars.

title: Most portable classical roguelike. Free, open source and no ads!

title: Controls are flawed.
comment: A good roguelike game, especially for being on mobile. However, the controls are a bit flawed. I tend to find myself moving in complete other directions than in the one I originally wanted to go. The system for using ranged weapons could stand to be improved as well. title: Pixel Dungeon Review
comment: Pixel Dungeon is a cool little Perma-Death turned based indie RPG game. It is quite simple, yet challenging at the same time. A few different kinds of enemies, randomly generated dungeons, and a few things that will force you to take a chance. For example, you can jump inside chasms. You don't know what's at the bottom (or if there is a bottom) so you never know if you are falling to your death, or if you are falling into a pile of awesome and useful items. The starving systems a bit annoying. 8/10 for me.

title: Best game on Android
comment: Pixel Dungeon is the best game on Android by far. It actually requires thought, unlike most mobile games. Also, even though it is inspired by other rougelikes, it is not a direct clone of another game with a different skin, unlike most other mobile games. Finally, it is HARD, wich gives it good replay value, because the developer has nothing to gain from making it easy (i.e. boring), since he published it to play for free, because he has your entertainment in mind, not your money.

title: My favorite game of 2014
comment: Incorporating a fantastic idea of intricate yet ever changing sets of items, layouts, & mobs, with a brilliant use of fundamental concepts, this game has me enthralled at a new adventure. Its use of several archetypes for the heroes/heroines makes it easy to pick favorites(Gladiator is my own). What this game lacks in relative difficulty, it profoundly makes up for in complexity. However, one suggestion I would make is different music over the variations of levels. I appreciate games like this good show!

title: Dungeon crawl!
comment: Best FREE game ever! Fun, difficult rogue-like RPG. Surprisingly deep gameplay, with item crafting/enchanting, potion brewing, traps, cursed items and lots of monsters. Expect to die often... Get used to it! Dungeons maps, loot, traps, and monsters are randomly generated within certain parameters for each level, so the game is different each time. Do yourself a favor and look up the wiki for this game and check out the strategy section... It will help you survive... If survival is possible. .

title: Best roguelike on play store
comment: Reinstated 5 star rating. I read the tumblr blog on the rationale behind degrading items and put in a few runs to play around with it, I understand the reasoning and it's quite clever. Keep that +5 weapon for when it's needed (your boss killing weapon) and use that spare one for dispatching the rank and file scum. Most of us had a kneejerk reaction because we had developed goto strategies for runs and the new mechanic forces us to develop new ones... I hope some other players of PD read this and get what I'm saying... the game is better for it and it opens up countless new approaches to a run and puts us out of that comfort zone we developed which imo is important in a roguelike. Read the blog, do some runs, work with the feature not against it and it suddenly makes total sense.
Tons of fun.  Finished the game on attempt 172 :-) EDIT: From 5 stars to one due to degrade items.  I broke my own rule and upgraded w/o reading reviews :-(

title: Simple and streamlined, but thoroughly deep and difficult of a roguelike
comment: I was looking one day and found Pixel Dungeon, but didn't try it out until now. I have played a fair amount of Nethack, and can say Pixel Dungeon shares the same elements as classic roguelikes. This game is inspired by Brogue from what people are saying, and I definitely saw some similarities in Pixel Dungeon that I felt comfortable playing the game. Anyway, the pixel art style is basic but gets the point across. The music and sound effects are nice touches to keep players engaged. The controls are very simple compared to bigger roguelikes, but the gameplay has enough complexity while still remaining relatively approachable to new players. With a nice looking pixel art style, some good music and sounds, and a simple control scheme and gameplay that ends up as complex as the big classic roguelikes, Pixel Dungeon makes for an excellent roguelike game for both beginners and veterans of the genre.

title: Lowered Rating
comment: Equipment degradation unbalances the game significantly.  Scrolls of Upgrade are already a finite resource that must be strategically used.  Now, regardless of early, late, or balanced usage they are worthless.  Further, "passive" items also degrade. A rogue's Ring of Shadows, for instance,  is going to lose its bonus by level 4 unless you burn a scroll on it. Terrible change in mechanics without any balance consideration, unless there is some secret that I haven't found yet.

title: Brutal, unforgiving but absolutely fair.
comment: This is an excellently balanced roguelike that is weighted towards SKILL with a little luck, not the other way around. Crying that the game is too random because you didn't get some item that you depend too much on isn't a problem with the game, it's a problem with your limited strategy. This is my favourite RL game to date on google play and it's 100% free and open source. Get it and prepare to die... until you learn to beat it, one death at a time. Fantastic little game.

title: My favorite Android game :) +TIP
comment: And I didn't even have to give any money! Thanks watabou for an amazing game :D. For all you struggling out there, find the Pixel Dungeon wiki on Google for info on potions, enchants, etc. And then here's some more obscure tips: hold the inventory button to view identified scrolls and potions, freezing raw meat is better than cooking it, stand in water as you fight Goo (removes Caustic Ooze debuff), if you are being chased go thru a door and kill enemy as it goes thru (even if it 1 square behind you).

title: Better than most PC roguelikes!
comment: The game is charming, aesthetically. It's pixellated, but it's done right. It has a very interesting "turn based" system, so to speak. When you're idle, time stops, but doing tasks costs time, including movement. The game never stops being challenging, even after you get enough strength to don your +4 plate armor of entanglement and wield your blazing glaive. The back story of the dungeon itself is simple, but intriguing. The 4 classes and endless possibilities will keep you entertained for months!
Very difficult, but very fun. Maybe add an actual tutorial?

title: Almost perfect
comment: Probably one of the best games on my system. There are quite a few flaws however, the night mechanic is a great example. It doesn't make any sense from a game design standpoint. Or any other standpoint, really. As far as I know there's no real benefit to playing at night unless you want to grind or something, but that's hardly an excuse. The player could easily just change their system time which would be tedious to do every time the game is booted up, not to mention it feels cheaty.

title: Hardcore
comment: This is a well made hardcore rogue-like. My only real complaint is mob chances and hunger. There really is very little food in the game to force you to continue on and not grind as you would go hungry and die. But you will get hungry FAST. You will average at least 2 pieces of food per level exploring it. As for mob spawns, it's very unlikely you will get to the first boss in your first 20 plays in the game.

title: Easy when you know how
comment: Some tips for newer players: When you see a tough enemy (like a crab) equip heavier armor. Even if you don't meet the STR requirement it will still provide damage mitigation. When the enemy is dead, take it off to remove the movement speed penalty. When you walk through a door you close it behind you, you can use this to your advantage against tough to hit enemies like wraiths by forcing them to eat a surprise attack (surprise attacks don't miss) when they follow you.

title: The crown jewel of Android rogue-likes
comment: Everything about this game is done right. Fans of retro-rpgs and frp geeks alike are going to love this relentlessly difficult, yet fun and addicting rogue-like rpg. This isn't for everyone, though, and more casual gamers will probably hate it because of its difficulty and randomly generated items. Regardless, this game is done amazingly in every way, right down to the fact that there are NO in-app purchases - just a small icon saying "please consider to donate". Truly a gem made by gamers, for gamers.

Be prepared to die a lot before you get the hang of it, I have sunk countless hours into this game on my phone and each time there a new update I rush to download it and check out the new features.  Anyone complaining about wanting save features or difficulty settings and giving low scores because of this clearly has no idea what a Roguelike is.  Just a brilliant game! Did I mention it's free?

title: Simple, but wonderful rogue-like
comment: The simple mechanics and graphical interface makes this rogue-like accessible while retaining the inherent difficulty that makes it good.  Because of the minimalistic nature of tablet/phone interaction, this game meshes it together despite the inherent problems with this genre on mobile platforms. There are a few things at the time of this review that could be improved, like adding a menu after death instead of relying on the 'back' button; however that and some other issues are minor usability things

In short for anyone looking for a rouge like with professional quality then look no further!

title: AMAZING! and a tip for new people
comment: I LOVE THIS GAME!!!! It is so much fun! I used to have trouble with killing the first boss with a rogue or a wizard, but I found out that a rogue, in the end, is better than the warrior, for instance - I got my warrior to lvl 21 and down into the demon inhabited part of the dungeon before he died, and I got my rogue to lvl 26 and I killed the two hands/fists/bosses/gods whatever you call them! (although I did have two rings of evasion +8, but my thieves armor was never upgraded, and my weapon was a mace that had +6 and I had a hell of a lot of healing potions lol). I love the wizard, I also love the fact that I always find either a potion of strength or a scroll of upgrade or sometimes both on the first floor. the boss btw is easy to kill heres how - step 1 go into the doorway and plant either a fire or poison plant, step 2 do not move from doorway until you have caught the Goo's attention, step 3 walk away from the doorway and if you have time plant a second fire/poison plant in a one way hallway, step 4 take up your last stand in the puddle while the Goo is on the stone floor. Hope that helps you guys who are struggling

title: Really well thought out and addictive.
comment: I don't write many reviews but this game compelled me to. Hands down the best Android game I've played. It's simple yet complex (play and you'll see what I mean). Playing this game and listening to music or podcasts has gotten me through a bunch of 4+ hour flight recently. This game just doesn't get old. The random level generation and item drops just makes it one of those, "I'll just play one more." Kinda games. Surviving past your previous best play is SO satisfying. Tip: read up a little on potions and scrolls- it can be a little confusing at first but once you understand the game mechanics it is absolutely incredible. Have fun. A huge THANK YOU to the dev. Well done!

title: Wonderful game
comment: This game is a perfect example of old style games that seem basic but have a whole different level of depth to them. Great turn based game (sadly a dying breed) very replayable and very challenging. Not a single complaint, this game is one in its own. The only thing that could make it better is more content (of course). Download the game, best free I ever spent. 👍 to the developer.

title: Done so well
comment: I've never seen a cell phone game done so well. The game is easy to pick up but has tons of depth. It's a rougelike with tons of replayability from randomized dungeons and loot, and there are several classes to choose from. No two games will ever be the same. Another big plus: no ads and no crazy permissions. I've never had a cell phone game keep my attention for so long. After a year of casual play, I final beat the game. But now, I get to go through it with the different classes that change up play style very significantly. Thanks for a great game, and I hope to see something on this caliber in the future.

title: Depth, simplicity & style are perfectly intertwined, delivering a great old school dungeon crawl RPG.
comment: Classes are well balanced w/the exception of the Huntress, who, unless played with extreme caution, may cause frustration in later lvls. Level design remains fresh; randomized dungeon layouts & item placement makes each playthrough unique. As difficulty is concerned, I enjoy the challenge & while some playthroughs seem doomed from the start, (due to scarce resources & higher grade items) each death is a lesson learned. In all, Pixel Dungeon is a top shelf RPG and an easy 5/5 star rating & its free! Donate!

title: here is a quick guide guys
comment: you will die a bunch of times on the first five floors. if at floor 5 without good armor and ignored the sad ghost quest, throw an earth root seed at a patch of water and run to it to fight goo, he will do little to no damage even when pumped. the shop is always adjacent to the stairs you entered on, just check. health potions are usually (not always) the most abundant potion you find, there are 2 str potion per 5 floors, and use scrolls of upgrade only on good equipment over 14 base level. good luck

comment: The software it's self works, I've encountered zero glitches however the gameplay is broken. Walking is a little odd and you tap to walk/attack/open chest/examine. You could be fighting a rat and then run across the dungeon from a misplaced tap. It gets dungeon exploring right, yet complicates the matter with an entirely new dungeon every time you restart (which is often BECAUSE THERE IS NO SAVE OPTION.) Items change. An azure potion could heal you or burn you. Frustrating.
Absolutely love it. My favorite phone game.

title: Exactly what I was looking for.
comment: I just wanted a game in which I could pass the first floor without dying over and over (starting over every time).  I like how the game keeps some things secret, (potions and scrolls), but it could really use a small tutorial.  And rats need a nerf.  Seriously, or give us more HP,  I've literally died on the first encounter with a rat.  Also, the game--thanks to its randomly generated sequence of maps--will often become impossible. (i.e. The black slime when you still have stock weapons and such.)  Food is really annoying as well!!!   ALWAYS hungry, more excited about a loaf of bread than I am an amazing sword, cause we all know we can't use any swords yet anyway.  (Speaking in context of the first 5 floors.)  I haven't even seen the shop yet.   Anyway, good game.  WAY to hard (at least for the beginning.)  Give the new players a break, don't kill them with one rat encounter.

title: For those who don't know
comment: In particular anyone crying about the difficulty, this is a Rogue-like. Search on Google and learn a little history.   Many of the games you love and play these days owe a massive debt to this genre. They are meant to be insanely random, insanely difficult. They aren't going to "fix" the difficulty for you. Too bad. Adapt and carry on and enjoy the crazy stuff that happens, slowly getting better, or move on back to your Candy Crush. *waves*

title: Awesome game. Learn to love it rather than ask to change it.
comment: This game is not pure luck. the element of risk and reward is what makes the game interesting. You can play smart and optimize your chances for success once you learn the mechanics, therefore it is not pure luck. The fish are not OP: every level with fish has an invisibility potion on it. Similarly, every level with a barricade has a potion of liquid flame in it and every level with a room full of inevitable traps guarding a treasure has a potion of levitation in it.  every level also has a food or even 2.

title: It's hard

Sure you could plan and try to get far but often you will run into something that will kill you (either by accident or taking on a monster beyond your fighting abilities). I don't recommend this game to anyone but those who like playing very hard games. It is frustrating but you feel awesome when you beat your best score. What I like the most about this game is it still updates with new shiny things pretty frequently. The reason I'm rating it 5 stars because it's the best rougelike game on the android.

title: Best game! Fully FREE!
comment: Yes, this is a challenging game - mostly luck-based but once you learn the mechanics there is some strategy involved. ; ) Intuitive touch interface gets you started very quickly! Fast startup so it's a great game even if you only have a few minutes at a time. Tips: - use zoom for ranged weapons/wands - save food for sleeping/healing (hold "wait" button) in early depths - retreat back through doors for guaranteed hits (esp. wraiths) - fighting the ooze, stand at the edge of water (ooze heals in water) - buy potions of healing! - don't use arcane stylus - the glyphs are not generally beneficial - upgrade armor (save scrolls of upgrade for plate armor!) - save seeds of earthroot for the bosses - learn from each death!! So many deaths... Awesome game, watabou! And thanks for the source code - great insight into the mechanics!

title: Simple and Challenging
comment: Pixel Dungeon is a great game that both an average smartphone user and RPG enthusiast can enjoy. The game play is easy to pick up, but simultaneously robust enough to offer strategy when diving into deeper dungeons. Unlike similar games available on the market, Pixel Dungeon is great for short and long sessions.

title: Seriously. Great game. DWM fans will feel right at home
comment: I haven't found one single thing I dislike about this. As a DWM fan, I love the random dungeons. The gameplay stays fresh, not knowing what is what each time I play. I am very happy to have come across this game.

title: Addictively fun
comment: This game is great!  It's unforgivingly difficult, and I've never personally made it past lvl 6, but you can easily spend hours just trying again and again.  It has a very classic dungeon crawler feel, but is also pretty elegant in the items it includes and how you use them.  Definitely one of the best android games I've found.  My only criticism is that luck plays such a huge role in how far you can get, which becomes super frustrating when you can due suddenly after investing a lot of time.

title: Hard, in the best sense possible
comment: This is an easy game to play, and to lose. Like any good roguelike, winning is an accomplishment unto itself. Adventurer death is permenant, and often unexpected. Since complete victory is so rare, there are in-game badges to celebrate the smaller moral victories of the game. And adventurers who make it to depth 11 unlock prestige subclasses, which remain available for subsequent adventurers and make surviving the early levels slightly easier.  It's a very simple roguelike, with only two or three character stats. Magic is stat agnostic and wands recharge with time. You only have a weapon slot and an armor slot, with an optional two rings. There's only around three  wandering monster types per dungeon section.  But there still is plenty of replayability, as you discover new room types, equipment combos, and subclasses. The maps are all generated randomly per adventurer, and equipment starts off unidentified and potentially harmful. When combined with the common theme and plot, it makes you eager to play through again so you can discover just a few more bits, and maybe this time... you'll win.
